text: Avaraham "Avi" Cohen (; November 14, 1956 - December 29, 2010) was an Israeli footballer. Born in Cairo, he joined the Maccabi Tel Aviv football club in 1975 and within a year was playing for the Israel national football team. He joined Liverpool F.C. in 1979 and played 24 games for them. He went back to Israel but returned to Britain to play 15 games with Rangers. He retired from playing in 1990 and became the chairman of the Israel Professional Footballers Association. He was also a football manager. Cohen died from head injuries in 2010 after his motorbike was hit by a car in Tel Aviv. He was not wearing a proper helmet, which also was not buckled up, when he was hit. ==References== Category:1956 births Category:2010 deaths Category:Egyptian Jews Category:Israeli football managers Category:Israeli footballers Category:Jewish Israeli sportspeople Category:Naturalized citizens of Israel Category:Road accident deaths Category:Deaths from head injury
